page.title: 14Attitudes
page.content: The town sits on the border of Lancashire and Yorkshire, and the red and white roses are entwined on the towns crest.The River Calder is culverted underneath the Town Hall and traditionally divided the county boundaries.Statues on the Town Hall depict the Lancashie cotton connection and the Yorkshire woollen industry. Today the town is officially in West Yorkshire and Calderdale for administrative purposes, but the Lancashire connection is still very strong. Todmorden Cricket Club plays in the famous Lancashire League.The postal address is Lancashire and the B.B.C. local news is from the North-West. Despite this dual identity, people have a strong sense of independence and committment to the town itself.
